a.title: Virtual Learning Extended Through School Year
a.span: Virtual Learning Extended Through School Year

li.a: Virtual Learning Extended Through School Year

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);
span.strong: UPDATED 4/9/2020: By order of Governor Parsons, all Missouri school districts will continue to keep buildings closed and extend their Virtual Learning Programs for the remainder of the school year as a precautionary measure to limit the spread of COVID-19. To read the full announcement and for more information related to COVID-19, please visit our COVID-19 Resource page under the "Community" tab or by clicking: https://bit.ly/bsdcovid19

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; text-decoration-line: underline; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);

div.p: While schools in Missouri are closed, Brentwood will conduct Board of Education meetings virtually. To view the livestream, please the district's YouTube channel at bit.ly/bsdyoutube. To submit a public comment to be read during an upcoming meeting, please email khastings@brentwoodmoschools.org.

div.p: Brentwood PD visits McGrath and Mark Twain students.
Students enjoy the first snow of 19-20 school year
Brian Nikodym named PLTW Exceptional Teacher.
Mark Twain students celebrate Principal Appreciation Month.
Brentwood students display their welcome brochure.

Brentwood School District, “Home of the Eagles,” is a highly rated public education resource offering a host of quality programs not normally found in a district of its size.
Established on March 3, 1920, shortly after the founding of the City of Brentwood, the district has a collective enrollment of 850 students among the Early Childhood Center, Mark Twain and McGrath Elementary schools (K-5), Brentwood Middle School (6-8), and Brentwood High School (9-12).
The Superintendent, Board of Education and school personnel work closely together with members of the Brentwood community to ensure the continuous improvement of the district.
In 2016, U.S. News & World Report selected Brentwood High School as one of the Best High Schools in the country, and the U.S. Department of Education named Mark Twain Elementary as a 2017 Blue Ribbon School.

span.style: font-family: latobold; font-size: 16px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 240);

p.span:
Brentwood will become a regional leader in providing a personalized and dynamic educational experience to every student.
OUR MISSION:
We see each child and support them on their individual pathways.
